page.title: 02A Child's Day in Marton.
page.content: A very important day in a Roman Catholic child's life is their First Communion Day. The child is prepared for this event at school.On the chosen day the childen go to church with their families.The girls wear white dresses,wreaths and veils;the boys white shirts,school tie, grey shorts and a red sash.During Mass the children read their own prayers from the altar. Specially chosen hymns are sung.The children receive the Host from the priest with joy and solemnity After Mass the children and their families return to school for a "breakfast".This consists of crisps, sandwiches and ice-cream.It is a friendly and happy occassion.The children each receive a medal and a certificate which has a symbol associated with Holy Communion on it.
